root: ^A man on the back of a horse that has clearly seen better days starts to gain on you.
^"Greetings, fellow traveler." he answers, slowing his horse to a trot. "We see Julius Bellthorp is not the only one who recognizes an opportunity when they see it."

ignore: ^The man audibly sniffs the stale air around him and smiles. "Ahh. Solemn desperation. Our favorite environment for profit."

^"Who is... " the man gasps indignantly. "Why -WE- are Julius Bellthorp of course! 'Only' the third most earning merchant of the Emporium this quarter my uninformed friend! And with this war just brimming with opportunity..."
^The man pauses dramatically "...We can feel our margin growing by the minute! Think of all those soldiers just desperate for our merchandise."

c-3: ^"Alas, my eager customer. Our stock is waiting for us in Brightcandle. But be sure to visit  once you've waded your way through these woods." he adds before lifting his pretentious hat.
^"For now, we bid you good day and do remember the name Julius Bellthorp should you need any supplies in your no doubt-well-intended endeavours!"
c-4: ^The merchant frowns and subconsciously runs a hand over his generous waistline. "Hmmpf. You have no better manners than that Paladin brute who accosted me just moments ago."
^"Fine - Julius Bellthorp will go and find better company in Brightcandle. Good. Day!"

greet: ^"Ahh, some signs of civilization after all. We were starting to lose hope after that man accosted me near the entrance of these damnable woods."

^The man smiles and briefly lifts his pretentious hat. "But we mustn't tarry! Profits await so we bid you good day, adventurer - do remember the name Julius Bellthorp should you need any supplies in your no doubt-well intended endeavours!"
